functions.name: addCompositeSchedule

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the new composite schedule

params.name: scheduleOne
params.description: The name of the first schedule to combine

params.name: scheduleTwo
params.description: The name of the second schedule to combine

returns.description: A UIResponse object with getWarns(), getErrors(), and getInfos() methods

functions.description: Creates a composite schedule by combining two existing schedules.

params.name: holiday
params.description: A HolidayModel object defining the holiday name, date, and recurrence

returns.description: A UIResponse object with getWarns(), getErrors(), and getInfos() methods

functions.description: Adds a new holiday to the system.

params.description: The name of the user source to add the role to

params.description: The name of the new role to add

functions.name: addSchedule

params.name: schedule
params.description: A schedule model object defining the schedule configuration

returns.description: A UIResponse object with getWarns(), getErrors(), and getInfos() methods

functions.description: Adds a new schedule to the system.

functions.name: addUser

params.name: userSource
params.description: The user source to add the user to. An empty string uses the project's default user source

params.name: user
params.description: A User object created via system.user.getNewUser()

returns.description: A UIResponse object with getWarns(), getErrors(), and getInfos() methods

functions.description: Adds a new user to the specified user source.
functions.long_description: Creates a new user account in the given user source. The User object should be created with system.user.getNewUser() and configured with properties, roles, and contact info before being passed to this function. Requires User Management client permission.
examples:
newUser = system.user.getNewUser('default', 'jsmith')
newUser.set('firstname', 'John')
newUser.set('lastname', 'Smith')
newUser.set('password', 'tempPass123')
newUser.addRole('Operator')
result = system.user.addUser('default', newUser)

functions.name: createScheduleAdjustment

params.name: startDate
params.description: The starting date and time of the schedule adjustment

params.name: endDate
params.description: The ending date and time of the schedule adjustment

params.name: isAvailable
params.description: True if the user is available during this period, False if unavailable

params.name: note
params.description: A note describing the reason for the adjustment

returns.description: A ScheduleAdjustment object that can be added to a user's schedule

functions.description: Creates a schedule adjustment (override) for a specific time period.

functions.name: editHoliday

params.name: holidayName
params.description: The name of the existing holiday to edit

params.name: holiday
params.description: The updated HolidayModel object

returns.description: A UIResponse object with getWarns(), getErrors(), and getInfos() methods

functions.description: Edits an existing holiday definition.

functions.name: editRole

params.name: userSource
params.description: The user source containing the role

params.name: oldName
params.description: The current name of the role

params.name: newName
params.description: The new name for the role

returns.description: A UIResponse object with getWarns(), getErrors(), and getInfos() methods

functions.description: Renames an existing role in the specified user source.

params.name: scheduleName
params.description: The name of the existing schedule to edit

params.name: schedule
params.description: The updated schedule model object

returns.description: A UIResponse object with getWarns(), getErrors(), and getInfos() methods

functions.description: Edits an existing schedule definition.

functions.name: editUser

params.name: userSource
params.description: The user source containing the user. An empty string uses the project's default user source

params.name: user
params.description: The modified User object (retrieved via getUser, then modified)

returns.description: A UIResponse object with getWarns(), getErrors(), and getInfos() methods

functions.description: Saves changes to an existing user in the user source, replacing previous data.
functions.long_description: Updates a user account by replacing all data with the provided User object. First retrieve the user with getUser(), make modifications, then pass the modified user to editUser(). Requires User Management client permission.
examples:
user = system.user.getUser('default', 'jsmith')
user.addRole('Supervisor')
user.set('lastname', 'Smithson')
system.user.editUser('default', user)

functions.name: getHoliday

params.name: holidayName
params.description: The name of the holiday to retrieve

returns.description: A HolidayModel object with the holiday definition, or None if not found

functions.description: Returns a specific holiday by name.

functions.name: getHolidayNames

returns.description: A list of all holiday names configured in the system

functions.description: Returns a list of all configured holiday names.

functions.name: getHolidays

returns.description: A list of all HolidayModel objects configured in the system

functions.description: Returns all holidays available in the system.

functions.name: getNewUser

params.name: userSource
params.description: The user source the new user will belong to

params.name: username
params.description: The username for the new user

returns.description: A new User (PyUser) object with methods for setting properties, roles, and contact info

functions.description: Creates a new User object for use with addUser(). Does not persist the user until addUser() is called.
functions.long_description: Factory method that creates a new User object pre-configured for the given user source. The returned object supports .set(property, value) for setting firstname, lastname, password, etc., .addRole(role) for adding roles, and .addContactInfo(dict) for contact details. Must be passed to system.user.addUser() to persist.
examples:
newUser = system.user.getNewUser('default', 'jsmith')
newUser.set('firstname', 'John')
newUser.set('lastname', 'Smith')
newUser.set('password', 'tempPass')
newUser.addRole('Operator')
newUser.addContactInfo({'email': 'john@example.com'})

functions.name: getRoles

params.name: userSource
params.description: The user source to retrieve roles from

returns.description: A list of role names available in the user source

functions.description: Returns all role names defined in the specified user source.

functions.name: getScheduledUsers

params.name: userSource
params.description: The user source to check for scheduled users

params.name: date
params.description: The date to check schedules for. If omitted, uses the current date and time

returns.description: A list of User objects for users currently scheduled (or scheduled at the given date)

functions.description: Returns a list of users that are scheduled at the current or specified date/time.

functions.name: getScheduleNames

returns.description: A list of all schedule names configured in the system

functions.description: Returns a list of all schedule names available in the system.

functions.description: Returns all available schedule models with full configuration information.

functions.name: getUser

params.name: userSource
params.description: The user source to search. An empty string uses the project's default user source

params.name: username
params.description: The username to look up

returns.description: A User object with all properties except the password. Returns None if not found

functions.description: Looks up a specific user by username in the given user source.

functions.name: getUsers

params.description: The user source to retrieve users from

returns.description: A list of User objects for all users in the user source

functions.description: Returns all users in the specified user source.

functions.name: getUserSources

returns.description: A list of objects representing all configured user source profiles

functions.description: Returns all user source profiles configured on the Gateway.

functions.name: isUserScheduled

params.name: user
params.description: The User object to check the schedule for

params.name: date
params.description: The date to check. Can be a Date object or Unix time in milliseconds. If omitted, uses the current date and time

returns.description: True if the user is scheduled at the given date/time, False otherwise

functions.description: Checks if a user is currently scheduled or scheduled at a specific date/time.
